intro: Keenania tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin keenania, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Keenania tonkinensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
